children.subject: <md>CS 294 (Visual Object and Activity Recognition) finished taking requests for enrollment at the end of july I think, so rip potentially. CS 294 (Advanced Topics in Learning and Decision Making) is taught by abbeel and he is pretty prompt with his emails, so you can just email him about it. If you are a 5th year MS, you might need to get through a filter since PhD students get priority.</md>

May I ask how you got into CS 294 (Advanced Topics in Learning and Decision Making)? I tried enrolling as well but our phase 1 is so late... now it's disabled. Also, where do you find the google form to fill out for CS 294 (Visual Object and Activity Recognition)? I tried emailing the prof but haven't heard back yet.

PS. I am also incoming fifth year MS :)

history.content:
I'm a 5th year MS student in EECS specializing in ML and would really appreciate some insight on how useful CS281A is to take.

For context, I've taken CS 189, CS 285, CS 288, and CS 270, and enjoyed them, but I want to focus more on the deep learning stuff as opposed to classical machine learning. I've also done a few internships in machine learning and I've been doing research in computer vision for the past year or so. I'm not planning on doing a PhD, and I'm probably going to go into industry in some kind of machine learning role (not sure how research focused vs. implementation focused it's gonna be).

Next semester I'm probably gonna be taking Math 104, CS 294 (Advanced Topics in Learning and Decision Making), and CS 294 (Visual Object and Activity Recognition) -- if I get in. I'm also planning on doing 20-25 hours a week of research and perhaps spending 10-20 hours on a startup. 

I kind of skimmed through the 281A textbook and it seems like it's pretty much an extension of 189 -- it focuses mainly on the statistical theory behind classical machine learning and decision making -- so I'm not sure how useful it's going to be.

Can someone who's taken the course comment on whether CS 281A is worth it or not and how much time it takes up?
history.subject: Is CS281A worth it?
